intro: Lasiobema retusum, commonly known as the rough-leaved lasiobema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rough, textured leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
